content.description: Lieback the wide crack to reach great hand jams the rest of the way to the anchors. Cleanest route at the crag.
content.protection: 5 bolts + anchors. Permadraws at the top.
content.location: Find the route on the left side of the small amphitheater at the top of the trail.

content.description: A serious of decent jugs requiring big moves and occasional slopers leading up to the anchors shared with Mike's crack.  Only part of the route that is shared with mikes crack is for the final move to the anchors.
content.location: On the vertical face directly to the right of mikes crack.  Top rope can be set up by leading Mike's Crack, unsure on if it is possible to reach anchors from above yet.

content.description: Start on the cracked ledges beneath the first bolt or in the chert to the right ~5'. Work towards a notch in the small roof to the left before moving right passing over the large block. Pull through the crux of small side pulls moving up to catch a large block below the bolts.
content.location: Follow the switch backs from the road leading to the amphitheater. This route is on the vertical face of the approach wall before reaching the big roof.

climbs.name: Grapefruits and Cannonballs AKA: The Long Face

content.description: Easy slab climb with plenty of good holds. This is a great route for someone to get their first lead. During summer and fall watch out for the wasp nests around the 6th bolts.
Short, well protected route on quality rock. Good for beginner leader.
content.location: Right most route on the approach trail wall

content.description: Start with a low tecky crux by keeping your balance and sticking the sharp crimps. Past here, look in to a hole in the rock you'll see a plastic skull warning you of what's to come. The next 50 feet is sustained 5.10a crimping before you reach a marvelous rest ledge with one of the best views at Delbow. Follow a crack a little ways from the ledge and power through the last roof to reach the chains.
content.location: Walk left of the amphitheater, pass mikes crack and, look for a tall, yellow colored dolomite cliff.

content.description:
Suggested to stick clip the first bolt. Start just on a good crimp and pinch just below the first clip. Move up to the crux, pull the sloping slide pull and work left to the cave feature left of the second bolt. There is a bomber chock stone in the top of the cave. Muscle past the cave to the gully. A 2 bolt anchor is high in the right face of the gully. 

 This route seeps groundwater following rain, beware of slimy jugs near the start and in the cave. Terrible when wet, fantastic when dry.
content.location: Follow the approach trail towards the amphitheater stopping before the switch backs end at a small climb. This route is in the overhanging section of the approach wall to the right of the wet chimney.

content.description: Start left hand side pull and right hand crimp. Go straight up the mini roof (crux) lay back the bottom right of roof. Left hand small 3 finger crimp above roof on face.  Right hand punch up high. Right heel/toe cam. Pull up the crimps to the nice left hand side pull. And finish route regular.  (Needs 2 bolts added to be safe for sport(first bolt add right face of roof, second near left hand side pull.)) Video on Instagram.com/fitness4sanity FA May10,2021 toprope solo.
content.protection: I set up a TR anchor on the tree above crimp and slime.  Would love to see the two bolts added so its able to be lead.
content.location: Climb straight up crimp and slime instead of going out right.

content.description: This route starts just to the right of College Dropout. It has its own two bolts at the start and the remaining three are shared with College Dropout. To climb this route uniquely, crimp strait up the slab, clipping the bolts to your left. Easier climbing can be found by traversing over to Dropout's line and climbing on the let side of the bolts.
Climb through the low crux by pulling the small roof and reach easier climbing for the remainder of the route. Shares 3 bolts and anchors with Community College.
Climbs found generally around the obvious ampitheater at the end of the approach trail.
